citation.article-title: Lactobacillus oris sp. nov. from human oral cavity.

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus oris sp. nov.

Lactobacillus oris (or'is. L. gen. n. oris, of the mouth). Cells are rod shaped (0.8 to 1.0 by 2 to 4 μm) and occur singly or in pairs or short chains. Colonies are small, raised, semirough, or rough. Gram positive. Nonmotile. Grows at 30 and 40°C but not at 22 or 48°C; some strains grow at 45°C. Facultatively anaerobic. Catalase negative. Heterofermentative, producing D and L-lactic acid. Gas is produced from glucose. Acid is produced from amygdalin, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, D-fructose, D-galactose, β-gentiobiose, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, melibiose, raffinose, D-ribose, sucrose, and D-xylose. Acid is not produced from L-arabitol, D-arabinose, adonitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, D-lyxose, mannitol, melezitose, a-methyl-D-mannoside, rhamnose, L-sorbose, sorbitol, starch, D-tagatose, L-xylose, and xylitol. Some strains produce acid from arbutin, cellobiose, gluconate, inulin, D-mannose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, β-methyl xyloside, N-acetylglucosamine, salicin, trehalose, and D-turanose. Some strains hydrolyze esculin and hippurate. Some strains produce urease. Arginine dihydrolase negative. H2S is not produced. Grows in 4% NaCl. Nitrate is not reduced. G+C content of DNA ranges from 49.3 to 50.7 mol% (m,). Isolated from human saliva.
In most respects the description of the type strain resembles the description of the species.
The type strain produces acid from gluconate; acid is not produced from arbutin, cellobiose, inulin, D-mannose, a-methyl-D-glucoside, β-methyl xyloside, trehalose, and D-turanose.
The type strain does not hydrolyze esculin.
